physical_examinations.vital_signs: Hemoglobin (Hb) 4.3 mmol/l, MCV 57.4 fl, ferritin 1 ug/l
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Palpitations, fatigue, dyspnoea on exertion; no gastrointestinal complaints.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Three months later, the anaemia completely resolved and ferritin level normalised.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recurrent pains in the stomach, anaemia; gastroscopy revealed no abnormalities.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Anaemia resolved after several months of iron supplementation despite continued exercising; ferritin levels remained low.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Fatigue, decreased exercise intolerance; no menstrual bleeding.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After starting oral iron supplementation, Hb, MCV, and ferritin levels normalised.
